result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DENNIS J STEFFENS

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
2:09 PM Defendant DENNIS J STEFFENS in court.  Attorney Aaron A. Nelson appeared by video for DENNIS J STEFFENS. Attorney Jessa K. Nicholson appeared by video for DENNIS J STEFFENS.   Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Nelson waives reading and enters NG pleas.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Final pre-trial on December 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:20 am. ADA Laura Nelson appeared in person for State of Wisconsin. Atty. Aaron Nelson appeared in person on behalf of Dennis J. Steffens. Defendant, Dennis J. Steffens appeared in person. Victim rights complied with - no victim present. ADA Nelson indicates that a victim impact statement is on file. Copy provided to Atty. Aaron Nelson. Lt. N. Prey sworn & questioned by ADA Nelson. ADA Nelson makes a statement to the Court regarding Marcy's Law and the victims initials being very similar. No objection by Atty. Aaron Nelson to use the first names instead of initials. The Court will allow counsel to use the first names instead of the initials of the victim(s). Objection-overruled. Continued direct examination. Objection-overruled. Continued direct examination. Witness identifies the Defendant. Record so reflects identification. Cross exam by Atty. Aaron Nelson. Objection-overruled. Continued cross exam. Objection-overruled. Continued cross exam. Objection-overruled. Continued cross exam. Redirect by ADA Nelson. Re-cross exam by Atty. Aaron Nelson. Final remarks by ADA Nelson.
Ruling- Court finds probable cause and binds matter over. 
ADA Nelson requests 30 days to file INFO and to schedule the ARGN after that. Atty. Aaron Nelson may appear via zoom at the ARGN but the Defendant must appear in person.

No contact with A.Q.E. 08-03-05. No contact with A.C.E. 02-22-00. No contact with there residence or place of employment. Must stay 1000 ft away at all times. No travel outside the state without prior court approval.
Preliminary hearing on August 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with A.Q.E 08-03-05. No contact with A.C.E. 02-22-00. No contact with there residence or place of employment. Must stay away 1000 ft at all times. No travel outside the state without prior court approval.

2:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant DENNIS J STEFFENS in court.  Attorney Aaron A. Nelson appeared by video for DENNIS J STEFFENS. Attorney Jessa K. Nicholson appeared by video for DENNIS J STEFFENS. State asks for $50,000 signature bond with conditions. Scheduling to take place off record.
